name: dandelion drift poncho
notes:
this pattern is free in a one size pattern below. a downloadable version is available for $2 with sizes xs-xl and visuals for the seam!

name: dandelion drift poncho
designer: jennie spellman
craft: knitting
category: neck / torso → poncho
difficulty: beginner

yarn weight: dk (11 wpi)
yarn used: drops belle
needle size: us 11 / 8.0 mm circular needle
gauge: 11 stitches and 18 rows = 4 inches in stockinette stitch
sizes available: one size (about a medium)
language: english

finished dimensions (before seaming):
width: 22” /  56 cm
length: 47” / 120 cm

materials needed:

yarn: drops belle (dk; 131 yds / 120 m per 50g ball)

needles: us 11 (8 mm) circular needle, 24" or longer
tapestry needle
scissors
measuring tape

gauge:
11 sts and 18 rows = 4" / 10 cm in stockinette stitch (unblocked)
matching gauge is recommended for accurate sizing.

this pattern is designed with love for new knitters who want to make something beautiful and wearable—with nothing more than knit, purl, and a little seaming. 

[pattern link here][1]


also available to buy on etsy, click [here][2]
